rationale: The segment does not contain an intensifier or comparative adjective directly modifying a risk-adjective.
The segment uses factual language ('have been reported'), lacking high-potency framing.
Contains scale ('27 human cases') but no moderate verb describing impact.
Segment does not contain a loaded rhetorical question.
Reports case numbers (bare fact) but contains no explicit calming cue.
The segment does not contain a bare negation.
Reports impact, not a capability or preparedness measure.
Reports 'there have been 27 human cases of bird flu reported', factually reporting a numerical metric.
